span.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a period of time between two dates or events
span.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: It’ll be difficult to hire that many new staff in such a short time span.
Over a span of ten years, the company has made great progress.
span.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the length of time over which someone’s life, ability to pay attention to something etc continues
span.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Captivity vastly reduces the life span of whales.
Most two-year-olds have a very short attention span.
span.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: the part of a bridge, arch etc that goes across from one support to another
span.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: the distance from one side of something to the other
span.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: a bird with a large wing span
span.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to include all of a period of time
span.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: a career which spanned nearly 60 years
span.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to include all of a particular space or area
span.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The Mongol Empire spanned much of Central Asia.
span.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: if a bridge spans an area of water, especially a river, it goes from one side to the other
